meanings.definition: To bet or gamble with the winnings from a previous bet.
meanings.sent1: After winning at poker, he decided to parlay his earnings into a game of blackjack.
meanings.sent2: She likes to parlay her lottery winnings into more tickets for the next draw.
meanings.sent3: Trying to parlay a small win into a big one, he ended up losing everything.
meanings.sent4: He attempted to parlay his luck at the casino into a fortune, but it quickly turned sour.
meanings.sent5: The gambler's strategy was to parlay each small victory into a larger one.

meanings.definition: To use success or luck to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: With his charm and wit, he was able to parlay his way into getting a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to parlay her good grades into a scholarship for college.
meanings.sent3: He tried to parlay his good mood into convincing his friends to go to the beach.
meanings.sent4: The team captain knew how to parlay his team's enthusiasm into a winning streak.
meanings.sent5: She managed to parlay her talent for painting into a successful career as an artist.

meanings.definition: A series of bets in which the original stake and winnings are wagered on successive bets.
meanings.sent1: His risky parlay on the horse races paid off with a huge jackpot.
meanings.sent2: The gambler placed a parlay on multiple football games, hoping for a big payout.
meanings.sent3: The parlay he made at the casino involved betting on three different games in a row.
meanings.sent4: She decided to try her luck with a parlay on the roulette table, combining her winnings each time.
meanings.sent5: The high roller's favorite strategy was to place a parlay on the most unpredictable games.
